isis.stitle: ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - GENERAL INFORMATION - 1992 - 1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcsubsecinfo.para: The electronic engines in this service section will to some extent diagnose the engine control systems and provide diagnostic codes that can be read through the data link connector, using electronic service tools, such as the ProLink.
The chapters also include diagnostic charts to assist in troubleshooting specific International circuits.

svcproc.title: DATA LINK CONNECTOR
svcproc.para: The data link is a data communications system that transfers electronic information between various components on and off the vehicle.
On 2000/8000 Series vehicles, the data link connector allows interfacing between on-board electronics and other electronic instruments.

The outline and pinout of the data link connector are shown in Figure 6.01. The connector has two pins, one labeled (+) and one labeled (-).The signal on these wires is very different from standard truck-type electrical signals. Truck signals usually are on or off and either 12 volts DC or zero volts DC. The data link connector wires, (+) and (-), carry a pulsed signal which may or may not be detected with a voltmeter. Refer to the specific chapter for pin/circuit information.
An ohmmeter can be used to check wires in the engine control circuits, but specific diagnostic equipment must be used to check for proper system operation and diagnostics.
